Over One Million Tickets Sold for FIFA World Cup 26™ as Global Demand Surges
Source: football-asian.com    Published: 2025-10-25 15:10:42

FIFA has announced that more than one million tickets have already been sold for the FIFA World Cup 26™, marking a major milestone on the road to football's biggest-ever tournament. Fans from 212 countries and territories have secured their seats following the completion of the Visa Presale Draw phase, which ran from mid-September. The surge in demand reflects the worldwide excitement surrounding the first 48-team World Cup, set to be co-hosted by the United States, Canada, and Mexico in 2026. Unsurprisingly, residents of the three host nations — the United States, Canada, and Mexico — were the most active buyers, topping the list in that order. They were followed by fans from England, Germany, Brazil, Spain, Colombia, Argentina, and France, rounding out the top ten markets for ticket sales. With 28 national teams already qualified, the early appetite for tickets has surpassed expectations. FIFA described the figure as “an exciting step” in the buildup to what promises to be the most inclusive and wide-reaching World Cup in history. FIFA President Gianni Infantino praised the enthusiasm shown by supporters across the world. “What an exciting step on our journey toward 2026!” Infantino said. “As national teams compete for their place at the historic FIFA World Cup 26™, I am thrilled that so many football-loving fans also want to be part of this watershed event in North America.” “The sale of more than one million tickets is an incredible response and a wonderful sign that the biggest, most inclusive FIFA World Cup in history is capturing the imagination of fans everywhere.” For those who missed out during the presale, the Early Ticket Draw phase opens Monday, 27 October, offering another opportunity to secure seats. Fans will be able to apply for single-match tickets across all 104 fixtures, as well as venue- and team-specific ticket packages. To protect supporters from unauthorised sales, FIFA's official resale platform is already available via FIFA.com/tickets, allowing eligible buyers to safely exchange tickets in compliance with local regulations. In Mexico, fans will be directed to a dedicated FIFA Ticket Exchange Platform. Meanwhile, official hospitality packages — including premium seating, dining, and exclusive experiences — are available at FIFA.com/hospitality. FIFA reiterated that all fans should purchase tickets only through official FIFA channels, as tickets acquired elsewhere may not be valid. With record-breaking global interest and ticket sales spanning over 200 nations, the 2026 World Cup is shaping up to be a defining chapter in football history. The world's largest-ever World Cup will take place across 16 host cities in North America, welcoming millions of fans to experience a tournament designed to celebrate diversity, unity, and the universal love of the game. “Football truly unites the world,” Infantino said. “And in 2026, the world will unite in North America.”
WORLD NATIONAL BUSINESS CRYPTOCURRENCY SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY HEALTH SOCCER TENNIS FORMULA_1 ENTERTAINMENT OTHER


Mexican Caribbean Gears Up for the 2026 World Cup: Cancún Travel Mart Builds New Partnerships for Future Growth
Source: Travel And Tour World    Published: 2025-10-25 13:54:14

Published on October 25, 2025 Cancún, one of Mexico's most iconic destinations, has once again proven its unparalleled significance in the international tourism industry. Hosted from October 22 to 24, 2025, the 37th edition of the Cancún Travel Mart highlighted the city's ongoing efforts to strengthen its position as a global tourism hub. With over 200 companies from more than 20 countries attending, this year's event focused on fostering meaningful business relationships and partnerships, ensuring the Mexican Caribbean's readiness for a surge in international visitors, especially with the upcoming 2026 FIFA World Cup just around the corner. Through a combination of strategic business negotiations, exclusive networking opportunities, and a vision of future tourism growth, the Cancún Travel Mart solidified its place at the center of global tourism development.Advertisement A Hub for Global Tourism: The 37th Cancún Travel MartThe Cancún Travel Mart, a major industry event in the heart of the Mexican Caribbean, was held at the luxurious Iberostar Selection Cancún. This year's event attracted more than 200 businesses from over 20 countries, including top international tourism markets such as Germany, Spain, Brazil, and the United States. Focused on enhancing the region's international appeal, the event offered a unique opportunity for both buyers and suppliers to engage in direct, pre-scheduled meetings.Key Highlights of the Event:Date & Venue: October 22-24, 2025, Iberostar Selection Cancún, MexicoParticipants: Over 200 companies from 20+ countriesEvent Focus: Business negotiations, contract development, last-minute seasonal bookingsNetworking Opportunities: Business lunches, evening functions, and exclusive meetingsTheme: “Stop Over in Cancún” aimed to enhance Mexico's role as a key tourism gateway ahead of the 2026 FIFA World CupThe event's format deviated from the traditional expo setup, focusing more on a streamlined business interaction style. Buyers had the opportunity to host booths, while suppliers visited them, reducing setup costs and promoting more in-depth, direct engagement. With its unique approach, this year's edition of the Travel Mart continued to push the boundaries of traditional trade shows, making it a highly efficient and cost-effective platform for businesses in the tourism sector.Advertisement Strengthening Strategic Partnerships for the FutureOne of the most significant aspects of the 37th Cancún Travel Mart was its emphasis on long-term partnerships. The event encouraged collaborations that go beyond immediate business deals. The connections formed during this year's meetings are set to influence not only the upcoming tourist seasons but also the broader trajectory of tourism development across the entire Caribbean region.Why Cancún Remains a Key Destination for Global Tourism:Proximity to Major Markets: As a popular vacation spot for American, Canadian, and European travelers, Cancún has consistently drawn high volumes of tourists from all over the world.Infrastructure Expansion: The Mexican Caribbean's ongoing investments in airport and hospitality infrastructure are designed to cater to the growing demand, particularly with the anticipation of the World Cup in 2026.Cultural and Natural Appeal: Beyond its beautiful beaches, Cancún offers rich cultural experiences, world-class hotels, and a range of natural attractions, from the ancient Mayan ruins to vibrant marine ecosystems.Safety and Comfort: The region continues to prioritize the safety and comfort of international visitors, with strong tourism policies and quality standards in place.With more than 3,850 business meetings and nearly $5 million USD in deals anticipated by organizers, the Cancún Travel Mart not only demonstrated the immense interest in Mexico's tourism sector but also set the stage for further growth in the coming years.The Growing Significance of the 2026 FIFA World Cup for Mexico's TourismAs the tourism industry looks ahead, the 2026 FIFA World Cup remains a major event influencing travel patterns in the region. Cancún is one of the key destinations in Mexico that will be welcoming international football fans, and the Travel Mart showcased the region's preparations for this global event.Anticipation for Increased Tourist Traffic: With millions of visitors expected during the World Cup, Mexico, and particularly Cancún, will experience an influx of international travelers. This will further solidify the city's position as one of the most sought-after destinations for both leisure and sports tourism.Marketing Strategies for the World Cup: The “Stop Over in Cancún” campaign aligns with broader tourism initiatives designed to boost visibility for the city and its surrounding areas during the global event.Tourism leaders believe that the preparations and strategic developments taking place today will pay off as Cancún and the Mexican Caribbean prepare for one of the most important periods in their tourism history. Events like the Cancún Travel Mart continue to showcase Mexico's readiness to accommodate the influx of international travelers, offering new opportunities and partnerships that will shape the future of the region's tourism industry.Looking Toward the Future: The Road to Industrialization and BeyondThe Cancún Travel Mart was not just about celebrating the current success of Mexico's tourism industry. It was also a stepping stone toward further industrialization and diversification. The recent announcement of new commercial developments, including the construction of two new shopping malls in Mérida by SDS Yucatán, highlights the broader economic transformation underway in the region.Business and Industrial Growth: The Yucatán Peninsula is experiencing a wave of industrialization that will continue to enhance its economic infrastructure, creating more opportunities for businesses in the tourism sector.Expo Pro Agro Innovación 2025: This event is just one example of how the region is diversifying its industries, not just relying on tourism but also strengthening agriculture and innovation sectors.Conclusion: A Bright Future for Cancún and the Mexican CaribbeanThe 37th Cancún Travel Mart further solidified the Mexican Caribbean's role as a premier global tourism hub. With strategic partnerships formed, business deals secured, and an eye toward the 2026 FIFA World Cup, the event showcased the region's resilience, ambition, and readiness for the future. The continued development of infrastructure, the expansion of tourist facilities, and the growth of new industries are all signs that the future of Cancún and the broader Mexican Caribbean is brighter than ever.As the region continues to adapt to the changing needs of global tourists, it remains a prime destination for international travelers seeking both adventure and relaxation in one of the world's most stunning locations.Advertisement Share On:Tags: america, Cancún, Iberostar, Mexican Caribbean, mexicoSubscribe to our NewslettersFollow Travel And Tour World in Google News Cancún, one of Mexico's most iconic destinations, has once again proven its unparalleled significance in the international tourism industry. With over 200 companies from more than 20 countries attending, this year's event focused on fostering meaningful business relationships and partnerships, ensuring the Mexican Caribbean's readiness for a surge in international visitors, especially with the upcoming 2026 FIFA World Cup just around the corner. This year's event attracted more than 200 businesses from over 20 countries, including top international tourism markets such as Germany, Spain, Brazil, and the United States. Focused on enhancing the region's international appeal, the event offered a unique opportunity for both buyers and suppliers to engage in direct, pre-scheduled meetings.Key Highlights of the Event:Date & Venue: October 22-24, 2025, Iberostar Selection Cancún, MexicoParticipants: Over 200 companies from 20+ countriesEvent Focus: Business negotiations, contract development, last-minute seasonal bookingsNetworking Opportunities: Business lunches, evening functions, and exclusive meetingsTheme: “Stop Over in Cancún” aimed to enhance Mexico's role as a key tourism gateway ahead of the 2026 FIFA World CupThe event's format deviated from the traditional expo setup, focusing more on a streamlined business interaction style. Buyers had the opportunity to host booths, while suppliers visited them, reducing setup costs and promoting more in-depth, direct engagement. With its unique approach, this year's edition of the Travel Mart continued to push the boundaries of traditional trade shows, making it a highly efficient and cost-effective platform for businesses in the tourism sector.Advertisement Strengthening Strategic Partnerships for the FutureOne of the most significant aspects of the 37th Cancún Travel Mart was its emphasis on long-term partnerships. The event encouraged collaborations that go beyond immediate business deals. The connections formed during this year's meetings are set to influence not only the upcoming tourist seasons but also the broader trajectory of tourism development across the entire Caribbean region.Why Cancún Remains a Key Destination for Global Tourism:Proximity to Major Markets: As a popular vacation spot for American, Canadian, and European travelers, Cancún has consistently drawn high volumes of tourists from all over the world.Infrastructure Expansion: The Mexican Caribbean's ongoing investments in airport and hospitality infrastructure are designed to cater to the growing demand, particularly with the anticipation of the World Cup in 2026.Cultural and Natural Appeal: Beyond its beautiful beaches, Cancún offers rich cultural experiences, world-class hotels, and a range of natural attractions, from the ancient Mayan ruins to vibrant marine ecosystems.Safety and Comfort: The region continues to prioritize the safety and comfort of international visitors, with strong tourism policies and quality standards in place.With more than 3,850 business meetings and nearly $5 million USD in deals anticipated by organizers, the Cancún Travel Mart not only demonstrated the immense interest in Mexico's tourism sector but also set the stage for further growth in the coming years.The Growing Significance of the 2026 FIFA World Cup for Mexico's TourismAs the tourism industry looks ahead, the 2026 FIFA World Cup remains a major event influencing travel patterns in the region. Cancún is one of the key destinations in Mexico that will be welcoming international football fans, and the Travel Mart showcased the region's preparations for this global event.Anticipation for Increased Tourist Traffic: With millions of visitors expected during the World Cup, Mexico, and particularly Cancún, will experience an influx of international travelers. This will further solidify the city's position as one of the most sought-after destinations for both leisure and sports tourism.Marketing Strategies for the World Cup: The “Stop Over in Cancún” campaign aligns with broader tourism initiatives designed to boost visibility for the city and its surrounding areas during the global event.Tourism leaders believe that the preparations and strategic developments taking place today will pay off as Cancún and the Mexican Caribbean prepare for one of the most important periods in their tourism history. Events like the Cancún Travel Mart continue to showcase Mexico's readiness to accommodate the influx of international travelers, offering new opportunities and partnerships that will shape the future of the region's tourism industry.Looking Toward the Future: The Road to Industrialization and BeyondThe Cancún Travel Mart was not just about celebrating the current success of Mexico's tourism industry. It was also a stepping stone toward further industrialization and diversification. The recent announcement of new commercial developments, including the construction of two new shopping malls in Mérida by SDS Yucatán, highlights the broader economic transformation underway in the region.Business and Industrial Growth: The Yucatán Peninsula is experiencing a wave of industrialization that will continue to enhance its economic infrastructure, creating more opportunities for businesses in the tourism sector.Expo Pro Agro Innovación 2025: This event is just one example of how the region is diversifying its industries, not just relying on tourism but also strengthening agriculture and innovation sectors.Conclusion: A Bright Future for Cancún and the Mexican CaribbeanThe 37th Cancún Travel Mart further solidified the Mexican Caribbean's role as a premier global tourism hub. With strategic partnerships formed, business deals secured, and an eye toward the 2026 FIFA World Cup, the event showcased the region's resilience, ambition, and readiness for the future. The continued development of infrastructure, the expansion of tourist facilities, and the growth of new industries are all signs that the future of Cancún and the broader Mexican Caribbean is brighter than ever.As the region continues to adapt to the changing needs of global tourists, it remains a prime destination for international travelers seeking both adventure and relaxation in one of the world's most stunning locations.Advertisement Share On:Tags: america, Cancún, Iberostar, Mexican Caribbean, mexicoSubscribe to our NewslettersFollow Travel And Tour World in Google News Advertisement A Hub for Global Tourism: The 37th Cancún Travel MartThe Cancún Travel Mart, a major industry event in the heart of the Mexican Caribbean, was held at the luxurious Iberostar Selection Cancún. This year's event attracted more than 200 businesses from over 20 countries, including top international tourism markets such as Germany, Spain, Brazil, and the United States. Focused on enhancing the region's international appeal, the event offered a unique opportunity for both buyers and suppliers to engage in direct, pre-scheduled meetings.Key Highlights of the Event:Date & Venue: October 22-24, 2025, Iberostar Selection Cancún, MexicoParticipants: Over 200 companies from 20+ countriesEvent Focus: Business negotiations, contract development, last-minute seasonal bookingsNetworking Opportunities: Business lunches, evening functions, and exclusive meetingsTheme: “Stop Over in Cancún” aimed to enhance Mexico's role as a key tourism gateway ahead of the 2026 FIFA World CupThe event's format deviated from the traditional expo setup, focusing more on a streamlined business interaction style. Buyers had the opportunity to host booths, while suppliers visited them, reducing setup costs and promoting more in-depth, direct engagement. With its unique approach, this year's edition of the Travel Mart continued to push the boundaries of traditional trade shows, making it a highly efficient and cost-effective platform for businesses in the tourism sector.Advertisement Strengthening Strategic Partnerships for the FutureOne of the most significant aspects of the 37th Cancún Travel Mart was its emphasis on long-term partnerships. The event encouraged collaborations that go beyond immediate business deals. The connections formed during this year's meetings are set to influence not only the upcoming tourist seasons but also the broader trajectory of tourism development across the entire Caribbean region.Why Cancún Remains a Key Destination for Global Tourism:Proximity to Major Markets: As a popular vacation spot for American, Canadian, and European travelers, Cancún has consistently drawn high volumes of tourists from all over the world.Infrastructure Expansion: The Mexican Caribbean's ongoing investments in airport and hospitality infrastructure are designed to cater to the growing demand, particularly with the anticipation of the World Cup in 2026.Cultural and Natural Appeal: Beyond its beautiful beaches, Cancún offers rich cultural experiences, world-class hotels, and a range of natural attractions, from the ancient Mayan ruins to vibrant marine ecosystems.Safety and Comfort: The region continues to prioritize the safety and comfort of international visitors, with strong tourism policies and quality standards in place.With more than 3,850 business meetings and nearly $5 million USD in deals anticipated by organizers, the Cancún Travel Mart not only demonstrated the immense interest in Mexico's tourism sector but also set the stage for further growth in the coming years.The Growing Significance of the 2026 FIFA World Cup for Mexico's TourismAs the tourism industry looks ahead, the 2026 FIFA World Cup remains a major event influencing travel patterns in the region. Cancún is one of the key destinations in Mexico that will be welcoming international football fans, and the Travel Mart showcased the region's preparations for this global event.Anticipation for Increased Tourist Traffic: With millions of visitors expected during the World Cup, Mexico, and particularly Cancún, will experience an influx of international travelers. This will further solidify the city's position as one of the most sought-after destinations for both leisure and sports tourism.Marketing Strategies for the World Cup: The “Stop Over in Cancún” campaign aligns with broader tourism initiatives designed to boost visibility for the city and its surrounding areas during the global event.Tourism leaders believe that the preparations and strategic developments taking place today will pay off as Cancún and the Mexican Caribbean prepare for one of the most important periods in their tourism history. Events like the Cancún Travel Mart continue to showcase Mexico's readiness to accommodate the influx of international travelers, offering new opportunities and partnerships that will shape the future of the region's tourism industry.Looking Toward the Future: The Road to Industrialization and BeyondThe Cancún Travel Mart was not just about celebrating the current success of Mexico's tourism industry. It was also a stepping stone toward further industrialization and diversification. The recent announcement of new commercial developments, including the construction of two new shopping malls in Mérida by SDS Yucatán, highlights the broader economic transformation underway in the region.Business and Industrial Growth: The Yucatán Peninsula is experiencing a wave of industrialization that will continue to enhance its economic infrastructure, creating more opportunities for businesses in the tourism sector.Expo Pro Agro Innovación 2025: This event is just one example of how the region is diversifying its industries, not just relying on tourism but also strengthening agriculture and innovation sectors.Conclusion: A Bright Future for Cancún and the Mexican CaribbeanThe 37th Cancún Travel Mart further solidified the Mexican Caribbean's role as a premier global tourism hub. With strategic partnerships formed, business deals secured, and an eye toward the 2026 FIFA World Cup, the event showcased the region's resilience, ambition, and readiness for the future. The continued development of infrastructure, the expansion of tourist facilities, and the growth of new industries are all signs that the future of Cancún and the broader Mexican Caribbean is brighter than ever.As the region continues to adapt to the changing needs of global tourists, it remains a prime destination for international travelers seeking both adventure and relaxation in one of the world's most stunning locations.Advertisement Share On:Tags: america, Cancún, Iberostar, Mexican Caribbean, mexicoSubscribe to our NewslettersFollow Travel And Tour World in Google News The Cancún Travel Mart, a major industry event in the heart of the Mexican Caribbean, was held at the luxurious Iberostar Selection Cancún. This year's event attracted more than 200 businesses from over 20 countries, including top international tourism markets such as Germany, Spain, Brazil, and the United States. Focused on enhancing the region's international appeal, the event offered a unique opportunity for both buyers and suppliers to engage in direct, pre-scheduled meetings.Key Highlights of the Event:Date & Venue: October 22-24, 2025, Iberostar Selection Cancún, MexicoParticipants: Over 200 companies from 20+ countriesEvent Focus: Business negotiations, contract development, last-minute seasonal bookingsNetworking Opportunities: Business lunches, evening functions, and exclusive meetingsTheme: “Stop Over in Cancún” aimed to enhance Mexico's role as a key tourism gateway ahead of the 2026 FIFA World CupThe event's format deviated from the traditional expo setup, focusing more on a streamlined business interaction style. Buyers had the opportunity to host booths, while suppliers visited them, reducing setup costs and promoting more in-depth, direct engagement. With its unique approach, this year's edition of the Travel Mart continued to push the boundaries of traditional trade shows, making it a highly efficient and cost-effective platform for businesses in the tourism sector.Advertisement Strengthening Strategic Partnerships for the FutureOne of the most significant aspects of the 37th Cancún Travel Mart was its emphasis on long-term partnerships. The event encouraged collaborations that go beyond immediate business deals. The connections formed during this year's meetings are set to influence not only the upcoming tourist seasons but also the broader trajectory of tourism development across the entire Caribbean region.Why Cancún Remains a Key Destination for Global Tourism:Proximity to Major Markets: As a popular vacation spot for American, Canadian, and European travelers, Cancún has consistently drawn high volumes of tourists from all over the world.Infrastructure Expansion: The Mexican Caribbean's ongoing investments in airport and hospitality infrastructure are designed to cater to the growing demand, particularly with the anticipation of the World Cup in 2026.Cultural and Natural Appeal: Beyond its beautiful beaches, Cancún offers rich cultural experiences, world-class hotels, and a range of natural attractions, from the ancient Mayan ruins to vibrant marine ecosystems.Safety and Comfort: The region continues to prioritize the safety and comfort of international visitors, with strong tourism policies and quality standards in place.With more than 3,850 business meetings and nearly $5 million USD in deals anticipated by organizers, the Cancún Travel Mart not only demonstrated the immense interest in Mexico's tourism sector but also set the stage for further growth in the coming years.The Growing Significance of the 2026 FIFA World Cup for Mexico's TourismAs the tourism industry looks ahead, the 2026 FIFA World Cup remains a major event influencing travel patterns in the region. Cancún is one of the key destinations in Mexico that will be welcoming international football fans, and the Travel Mart showcased the region's preparations for this global event.Anticipation for Increased Tourist Traffic: With millions of visitors expected during the World Cup, Mexico, and particularly Cancún, will experience an influx of international travelers. This will further solidify the city's position as one of the most sought-after destinations for both leisure and sports tourism.Marketing Strategies for the World Cup: The “Stop Over in Cancún” campaign aligns with broader tourism initiatives designed to boost visibility for the city and its surrounding areas during the global event.Tourism leaders believe that the preparations and strategic developments taking place today will pay off as Cancún and the Mexican Caribbean prepare for one of the most important periods in their tourism history. Events like the Cancún Travel Mart continue to showcase Mexico's readiness to accommodate the influx of international travelers, offering new opportunities and partnerships that will shape the future of the region's tourism industry.Looking Toward the Future: The Road to Industrialization and BeyondThe Cancún Travel Mart was not just about celebrating the current success of Mexico's tourism industry. It was also a stepping stone toward further industrialization and diversification. The recent announcement of new commercial developments, including the construction of two new shopping malls in Mérida by SDS Yucatán, highlights the broader economic transformation underway in the region.Business and Industrial Growth: The Yucatán Peninsula is experiencing a wave of industrialization that will continue to enhance its economic infrastructure, creating more opportunities for businesses in the tourism sector.Expo Pro Agro Innovación 2025: This event is just one example of how the region is diversifying its industries, not just relying on tourism but also strengthening agriculture and innovation sectors.Conclusion: A Bright Future for Cancún and the Mexican CaribbeanThe 37th Cancún Travel Mart further solidified the Mexican Caribbean's role as a premier global tourism hub. With strategic partnerships formed, business deals secured, and an eye toward the 2026 FIFA World Cup, the event showcased the region's resilience, ambition, and readiness for the future. The continued development of infrastructure, the expansion of tourist facilities, and the growth of new industries are all signs that the future of Cancún and the broader Mexican Caribbean is brighter than ever.As the region continues to adapt to the changing needs of global tourists, it remains a prime destination for international travelers seeking both adventure and relaxation in one of the world's most stunning locations.Advertisement Share On:Tags: america, Cancún, Iberostar, Mexican Caribbean, mexicoSubscribe to our NewslettersFollow Travel And Tour World in Google News Key Highlights of the Event:Date & Venue: October 22-24, 2025, Iberostar Selection Cancún, MexicoParticipants: Over 200 companies from 20+ countriesEvent Focus: Business negotiations, contract development, last-minute seasonal bookingsNetworking Opportunities: Business lunches, evening functions, and exclusive meetingsTheme: “Stop Over in Cancún” aimed to enhance Mexico's role as a key tourism gateway ahead of the 2026 FIFA World CupThe event's format deviated from the traditional expo setup, focusing more on a streamlined business interaction style. Buyers had the opportunity to host booths, while suppliers visited them, reducing setup costs and promoting more in-depth, direct engagement. With its unique approach, this year's edition of the Travel Mart continued to push the boundaries of traditional trade shows, making it a highly efficient and cost-effective platform for businesses in the tourism sector.Advertisement Strengthening Strategic Partnerships for the FutureOne of the most significant aspects of the 37th Cancún Travel Mart was its emphasis on long-term partnerships. The event encouraged collaborations that go beyond immediate business deals. The connections formed during this year's meetings are set to influence not only the upcoming tourist seasons but also the broader trajectory of tourism development across the entire Caribbean region.Why Cancún Remains a Key Destination for Global Tourism:Proximity to Major Markets: As a popular vacation spot for American, Canadian, and European travelers, Cancún has consistently drawn high volumes of tourists from all over the world.Infrastructure Expansion: The Mexican Caribbean's ongoing investments in airport and hospitality infrastructure are designed to cater to the growing demand, particularly with the anticipation of the World Cup in 2026.Cultural and Natural Appeal: Beyond its beautiful beaches, Cancún offers rich cultural experiences, world-class hotels, and a range of natural attractions, from the ancient Mayan ruins to vibrant marine ecosystems.Safety and Comfort: The region continues to prioritize the safety and comfort of international visitors, with strong tourism policies and quality standards in place.With more than 3,850 business meetings and nearly $5 million USD in deals anticipated by organizers, the Cancún Travel Mart not only demonstrated the immense interest in Mexico's tourism sector but also set the stage for further growth in the coming years.The Growing Significance of the 2026 FIFA World Cup for Mexico's TourismAs the tourism industry looks ahead, the 2026 FIFA World Cup remains a major event influencing travel patterns in the region. Cancún is one of the key destinations in Mexico that will be welcoming international football fans, and the Travel Mart showcased the region's preparations for this global event.Anticipation for Increased Tourist Traffic: With millions of visitors expected during the World Cup, Mexico, and particularly Cancún, will experience an influx of international travelers. This will further solidify the city's position as one of the most sought-after destinations for both leisure and sports tourism.Marketing Strategies for the World Cup: The “Stop Over in Cancún” campaign aligns with broader tourism initiatives designed to boost visibility for the city and its surrounding areas during the global event.Tourism leaders believe that the preparations and strategic developments taking place today will pay off as Cancún and the Mexican Caribbean prepare for one of the most important periods in their tourism history. Events like the Cancún Travel Mart continue to showcase Mexico's readiness to accommodate the influx of international travelers, offering new opportunities and partnerships that will shape the future of the region's tourism industry.Looking Toward the Future: The Road to Industrialization and BeyondThe Cancún Travel Mart was not just about celebrating the current success of Mexico's tourism industry. It was also a stepping stone toward further industrialization and diversification. The recent announcement of new commercial developments, including the construction of two new shopping malls in Mérida by SDS Yucatán, highlights the broader economic transformation underway in the region.Business and Industrial Growth: The Yucatán Peninsula is experiencing a wave of industrialization that will continue to enhance its economic infrastructure, creating more opportunities for businesses in the tourism sector.Expo Pro Agro Innovación 2025: This event is just one example of how the region is diversifying its industries, not just relying on tourism but also strengthening agriculture and innovation sectors.Conclusion: A Bright Future for Cancún and the Mexican CaribbeanThe 37th Cancún Travel Mart further solidified the Mexican Caribbean's role as a premier global tourism hub. With strategic partnerships formed, business deals secured, and an eye toward the 2026 FIFA World Cup, the event showcased the region's resilience, ambition, and readiness for the future. The continued development of infrastructure, the expansion of tourist facilities, and the growth of new industries are all signs that the future of Cancún and the broader Mexican Caribbean is brighter than ever.As the region continues to adapt to the changing needs of global tourists, it remains a prime destination for international travelers seeking both adventure and relaxation in one of the world's most stunning locations.Advertisement Share On:Tags: america, Cancún, Iberostar, Mexican Caribbean, mexicoSubscribe to our NewslettersFollow Travel And Tour World in Google News The event's format deviated from the traditional expo setup, focusing more on a streamlined business interaction style. Buyers had the opportunity to host booths, while suppliers visited them, reducing setup costs and promoting more in-depth, direct engagement. With its unique approach, this year's edition of the Travel Mart continued to push the boundaries of traditional trade shows, making it a highly efficient and cost-effective platform for businesses in the tourism sector.Advertisement Strengthening Strategic Partnerships for the FutureOne of the most significant aspects of the 37th Cancún Travel Mart was its emphasis on long-term partnerships. The event encouraged collaborations that go beyond immediate business deals. The connections formed during this year's meetings are set to influence not only the upcoming tourist seasons but also the broader trajectory of tourism development across the entire Caribbean region.Why Cancún Remains a Key Destination for Global Tourism:Proximity to Major Markets: As a popular vacation spot for American, Canadian, and European travelers, Cancún has consistently drawn high volumes of tourists from all over the world.Infrastructure Expansion: The Mexican Caribbean's ongoing investments in airport and hospitality infrastructure are designed to cater to the growing demand, particularly with the anticipation of the World Cup in 2026.Cultural and Natural Appeal: Beyond its beautiful beaches, Cancún offers rich cultural experiences, world-class hotels, and a range of natural attractions, from the ancient Mayan ruins to vibrant marine ecosystems.Safety and Comfort: The region continues to prioritize the safety and comfort of international visitors, with strong tourism policies and quality standards in place.With more than 3,850 business meetings and nearly $5 million USD in deals anticipated by organizers, the Cancún Travel Mart not only demonstrated the immense interest in Mexico's tourism sector but also set the stage for further growth in the coming years.The Growing Significance of the 2026 FIFA World Cup for Mexico's TourismAs the tourism industry looks ahead, the 2026 FIFA World Cup remains a major event influencing travel patterns in the region. Cancún is one of the key destinations in Mexico that will be welcoming international football fans, and the Travel Mart showcased the region's preparations for this global event.Anticipation for Increased Tourist Traffic: With millions of visitors expected during the World Cup, Mexico, and particularly Cancún, will experience an influx of international travelers. This will further solidify the city's position as one of the most sought-after destinations for both leisure and sports tourism.Marketing Strategies for the World Cup: The “Stop Over in Cancún” campaign aligns with broader tourism initiatives designed to boost visibility for the city and its surrounding areas during the global event.Tourism leaders believe that the preparations and strategic developments taking place today will pay off as Cancún and the Mexican Caribbean prepare for one of the most important periods in their tourism history. Events like the Cancún Travel Mart continue to showcase Mexico's readiness to accommodate the influx of international travelers, offering new opportunities and partnerships that will shape the future of the region's tourism industry.Looking Toward the Future: The Road to Industrialization and BeyondThe Cancún Travel Mart was not just about celebrating the current success of Mexico's tourism industry. It was also a stepping stone toward further industrialization and diversification. The recent announcement of new commercial developments, including the construction of two new shopping malls in Mérida by SDS Yucatán, highlights the broader economic transformation underway in the region.Business and Industrial Growth: The Yucatán Peninsula is experiencing a wave of industrialization that will continue to enhance its economic infrastructure, creating more opportunities for businesses in the tourism sector.Expo Pro Agro Innovación 2025: This event is just one example of how the region is diversifying its industries, not just relying on tourism but also strengthening agriculture and innovation sectors.Conclusion: A Bright Future for Cancún and the Mexican CaribbeanThe 37th Cancún Travel Mart further solidified the Mexican Caribbean's role as a premier global tourism hub. With strategic partnerships formed, business deals secured, and an eye toward the 2026 FIFA World Cup, the event showcased the region's resilience, ambition, and readiness for the future. The continued development of infrastructure, the expansion of tourist facilities, and the growth of new industries are all signs that the future of Cancún and the broader Mexican Caribbean is brighter than ever.As the region continues to adapt to the changing needs of global tourists, it remains a prime destination for international travelers seeking both adventure and relaxation in one of the world's most stunning locations.Advertisement Share On:Tags: america, Cancún, Iberostar, Mexican Caribbean, mexicoSubscribe to our NewslettersFollow Travel And Tour World in Google News Advertisement Strengthening Strategic Partnerships for the FutureOne of the most significant aspects of the 37th Cancún Travel Mart was its emphasis on long-term partnerships. Cancún is one of the key destinations in Mexico that will be welcoming international football fans, and the Travel Mart showcased the region's preparations for this global event.Anticipation for Increased Tourist Traffic: With millions of visitors expected during the World Cup, Mexico, and particularly Cancún, will experience an influx of international travelers. This will further solidify the city's position as one of the most sought-after destinations for both leisure and sports tourism.Marketing Strategies for the World Cup: The “Stop Over in Cancún” campaign aligns with broader tourism initiatives designed to boost visibility for the city and its surrounding areas during the global event.Tourism leaders believe that the preparations and strategic developments taking place today will pay off as Cancún and the Mexican Caribbean prepare for one of the most important periods in their tourism history. Events like the Cancún Travel Mart continue to showcase Mexico's readiness to accommodate the influx of international travelers, offering new opportunities and partnerships that will shape the future of the region's tourism industry.Looking Toward the Future: The Road to Industrialization and BeyondThe Cancún Travel Mart was not just about celebrating the current success of Mexico's tourism industry. It was also a stepping stone toward further industrialization and diversification. The recent announcement of new commercial developments, including the construction of two new shopping malls in Mérida by SDS Yucatán, highlights the broader economic transformation underway in the region.Business and Industrial Growth: The Yucatán Peninsula is experiencing a wave of industrialization that will continue to enhance its economic infrastructure, creating more opportunities for businesses in the tourism sector.Expo Pro Agro Innovación 2025: This event is just one example of how the region is diversifying its industries, not just relying on tourism but also strengthening agriculture and innovation sectors.Conclusion: A Bright Future for Cancún and the Mexican CaribbeanThe 37th Cancún Travel Mart further solidified the Mexican Caribbean's role as a premier global tourism hub. With strategic partnerships formed, business deals secured, and an eye toward the 2026 FIFA World Cup, the event showcased the region's resilience, ambition, and readiness for the future. The continued development of infrastructure, the expansion of tourist facilities, and the growth of new industries are all signs that the future of Cancún and the broader Mexican Caribbean is brighter than ever.As the region continues to adapt to the changing needs of global tourists, it remains a prime destination for international travelers seeking both adventure and relaxation in one of the world's most stunning locations.Advertisement Share On:Tags: america, Cancún, Iberostar, Mexican Caribbean, mexicoSubscribe to our NewslettersFollow Travel And Tour World in Google News One of the most significant aspects of the 37th Cancún Travel Mart was its emphasis on long-term partnerships. Cancún is one of the key destinations in Mexico that will be welcoming international football fans, and the Travel Mart showcased the region's preparations for this global event.Anticipation for Increased Tourist Traffic: With millions of visitors expected during the World Cup, Mexico, and particularly Cancún, will experience an influx of international travelers. This will further solidify the city's position as one of the most sought-after destinations for both leisure and sports tourism.Marketing Strategies for the World Cup: The “Stop Over in Cancún” campaign aligns with broader tourism initiatives designed to boost visibility for the city and its surrounding areas during the global event.Tourism leaders believe that the preparations and strategic developments taking place today will pay off as Cancún and the Mexican Caribbean prepare for one of the most important periods in their tourism history. Events like the Cancún Travel Mart continue to showcase Mexico's readiness to accommodate the influx of international travelers, offering new opportunities and partnerships that will shape the future of the region's tourism industry.Looking Toward the Future: The Road to Industrialization and BeyondThe Cancún Travel Mart was not just about celebrating the current success of Mexico's tourism industry. It was also a stepping stone toward further industrialization and diversification. The recent announcement of new commercial developments, including the construction of two new shopping malls in Mérida by SDS Yucatán, highlights the broader economic transformation underway in the region.Business and Industrial Growth: The Yucatán Peninsula is experiencing a wave of industrialization that will continue to enhance its economic infrastructure, creating more opportunities for businesses in the tourism sector.Expo Pro Agro Innovación 2025: This event is just one example of how the region is diversifying its industries, not just relying on tourism but also strengthening agriculture and innovation sectors.Conclusion: A Bright Future for Cancún and the Mexican CaribbeanThe 37th Cancún Travel Mart further solidified the Mexican Caribbean's role as a premier global tourism hub. With strategic partnerships formed, business deals secured, and an eye toward the 2026 FIFA World Cup, the event showcased the region's resilience, ambition, and readiness for the future. The continued development of infrastructure, the expansion of tourist facilities, and the growth of new industries are all signs that the future of Cancún and the broader Mexican Caribbean is brighter than ever.As the region continues to adapt to the changing needs of global tourists, it remains a prime destination for international travelers seeking both adventure and relaxation in one of the world's most stunning locations.Advertisement Share On:Tags: america, Cancún, Iberostar, Mexican Caribbean, mexicoSubscribe to our NewslettersFollow Travel And Tour World in Google News Why Cancún Remains a Key Destination for Global Tourism:Proximity to Major Markets: As a popular vacation spot for American, Canadian, and European travelers, Cancún has consistently drawn high volumes of tourists from all over the world.Infrastructure Expansion: The Mexican Caribbean's ongoing investments in airport and hospitality infrastructure are designed to cater to the growing demand, particularly with the anticipation of the World Cup in 2026.Cultural and Natural Appeal: Beyond its beautiful beaches, Cancún offers rich cultural experiences, world-class hotels, and a range of natural attractions, from the ancient Mayan ruins to vibrant marine ecosystems.Safety and Comfort: The region continues to prioritize the safety and comfort of international visitors, with strong tourism policies and quality standards in place.With more than 3,850 business meetings and nearly $5 million USD in deals anticipated by organizers, the Cancún Travel Mart not only demonstrated the immense interest in Mexico's tourism sector but also set the stage for further growth in the coming years.The Growing Significance of the 2026 FIFA World Cup for Mexico's TourismAs the tourism industry looks ahead, the 2026 FIFA World Cup remains a major event influencing travel patterns in the region. With strategic partnerships formed, business deals secured, and an eye toward the 2026 FIFA World Cup, the event showcased the region's resilience, ambition, and readiness for the future. The continued development of infrastructure, the expansion of tourist facilities, and the growth of new industries are all signs that the future of Cancún and the broader Mexican Caribbean is brighter than ever.As the region continues to adapt to the changing needs of global tourists, it remains a prime destination for international travelers seeking both adventure and relaxation in one of the world's most stunning locations.Advertisement Share On:Tags: america, Cancún, Iberostar, Mexican Caribbean, mexicoSubscribe to our NewslettersFollow Travel And Tour World in Google News With more than 3,850 business meetings and nearly $5 million USD in deals anticipated by organizers, the Cancún Travel Mart not only demonstrated the immense interest in Mexico's tourism sector but also set the stage for further growth in the coming years.The Growing Significance of the 2026 FIFA World Cup for Mexico's TourismAs the tourism industry looks ahead, the 2026 FIFA World Cup remains a major event influencing travel patterns in the region. Cancún is one of the key destinations in Mexico that will be welcoming international football fans, and the Travel Mart showcased the region's preparations for this global event.Anticipation for Increased Tourist Traffic: With millions of visitors expected during the World Cup, Mexico, and particularly Cancún, will experience an influx of international travelers. This will further solidify the city's position as one of the most sought-after destinations for both leisure and sports tourism.Marketing Strategies for the World Cup: The “Stop Over in Cancún” campaign aligns with broader tourism initiatives designed to boost visibility for the city and its surrounding areas during the global event.Tourism leaders believe that the preparations and strategic developments taking place today will pay off as Cancún and the Mexican Caribbean prepare for one of the most important periods in their tourism history. Events like the Cancún Travel Mart continue to showcase Mexico's readiness to accommodate the influx of international travelers, offering new opportunities and partnerships that will shape the future of the region's tourism industry.Looking Toward the Future: The Road to Industrialization and BeyondThe Cancún Travel Mart was not just about celebrating the current success of Mexico's tourism industry. It was also a stepping stone toward further industrialization and diversification. The recent announcement of new commercial developments, including the construction of two new shopping malls in Mérida by SDS Yucatán, highlights the broader economic transformation underway in the region.Business and Industrial Growth: The Yucatán Peninsula is experiencing a wave of industrialization that will continue to enhance its economic infrastructure, creating more opportunities for businesses in the tourism sector.Expo Pro Agro Innovación 2025: This event is just one example of how the region is diversifying its industries, not just relying on tourism but also strengthening agriculture and innovation sectors.Conclusion: A Bright Future for Cancún and the Mexican CaribbeanThe 37th Cancún Travel Mart further solidified the Mexican Caribbean's role as a premier global tourism hub. With strategic partnerships formed, business deals secured, and an eye toward the 2026 FIFA World Cup, the event showcased the region's resilience, ambition, and readiness for the future. The continued development of infrastructure, the expansion of tourist facilities, and the growth of new industries are all signs that the future of Cancún and the broader Mexican Caribbean is brighter than ever.As the region continues to adapt to the changing needs of global tourists, it remains a prime destination for international travelers seeking both adventure and relaxation in one of the world's most stunning locations.Advertisement Share On:Tags: america, Cancún, Iberostar, Mexican Caribbean, mexicoSubscribe to our NewslettersFollow Travel And Tour World in Google News The Growing Significance of the 2026 FIFA World Cup for Mexico's TourismAs the tourism industry looks ahead, the 2026 FIFA World Cup remains a major event influencing travel patterns in the region. David Beckham treatment slammed by MLS fans upset by Lionel Messi allegation
Source: Manchester Evening News    Published: 2025-10-25 12:44:00

Lionel Messi and David Beckham faced accusations of receiving preferential treatment from FIFA after Inter Miami secured a place in the inaugural Club World Cup. The sport's world governing body came under fire for awarding the host nation berth to Inter Miami – and consequently, Messi – despite the team not having clinched the Major League Soccer title. Remarks from FIFA president Gianni Infantino, apparently encouraging participating teams to recruit another footballing legend in Cristiano Ronaldo, only heightened suspicions among critics. Miami were also granted the privilege of staging the tournament's curtain-raiser at their Hard Rock Stadium. Speaking on the pitch at an MLS fixture prior to the competition, Infantino declared: "Miami loves football, the world loves football and the world loves Miami. So I have three things to tell you. "The first: many congratulations for winning the Supporters' Shield [the regular season league before the play-offs]. And on top, with the record of points in Major League Soccer. "Congratulations, you are the best team of the season in America. Second, based on this outstanding performance this year, you deserve to be, and you will be, for the FIFA Club World Cup 2025. "And third, as the host team of the FIFA Club World Cup 2025, you will have the honour of opening the tournament by hosting the opening game here in Miami at the Hard Rock Stadium in front of 65,000 people and tens of millions at home." Many MLS fans were not impressed, believing that Miami was favoured due to having the world's best player and one of football's most recognisable faces, Beckham, as a co-owner. One disgruntled fan summed up the frustration of many, posting on X: "The criteria was always the same. Whichever team had Lionel Messi was gonna qualify." Another concurred, posting: "Even if Miami had the worst season of their history, they would have still gotten the spot. The fact that there was no criteria to get the spot means that FIFA and the MLS intended to ask Miami to fill in the final spot, they just needed a good excuse." Despite the controversy, Miami arguably proved their worth in the tournament, progressing from their group with one victory and two draws before being trounced 4-0 by Paris Saint-Germain in the round of 16. Miami supporters can anticipate more mesmerising performances from Messi after the Argentine legend signed a new long-term contract with the club. It ensures the eight-time Ballon d'Or winner will be part of the team when they relocate to their new Freedom Park stadium in 2026. Messi expressed his delight, saying: "It makes me really happy to stay here and to continue with this project that, besides being a dream, has become a beautiful reality - playing in this stadium, at Miami Freedom Park. Since I arrived in Miami, I've been very happy, so I'm truly glad to keep going here." Here at the Manchester Evening News, we're dedicated to bringing you the best Manchester United coverage and analysis. Make sure you don't miss out on the latest United news by joining our free WhatsApp group. You can get all the breaking news and best analysis sent straight to your phone by clicking here to subscribe. You can also subscribe to our free newsletter service. Click here to be sent all the day's biggest stories. And finally, if you'd rather listen to our expert analysis then make sure to check out our Manchester is Red podcast. Our shows are available on all podcast platforms, including Spotify and Apple Podcasts, and you can also watch along on YouTube. Fanatics has slashed the price of Man United kits and merch with up to 60% off select items. You can opt out of the sale or sharing of your data, at any time clicking the "Do Not Sell or Share my Data" button at the bottom of the webpage. Please note that your preferences are browser specific. USA completes first sweep in group stage at U-17 Women's World Cup
Source: Soccer America    Published: 2025-10-25 12:27:42

Soccer America Home for America's Passionate Soccer Fans The USA beat Norway 5-0 to make it three wins in three games and win Group C at the U-17 Women's World Cup in Morocco. Lionel Messi allegation that upset MLS fans with David Beckham treatment slammed
Source: The Mirror    Published: 2025-10-25 11:49:00

Lionel Messi and David Beckham were accused of benefiting from FIFA favouritism after Inter Miami were awarded a spot in the inaugural Club World Cup. Football's global governing body received considerable criticism for awarding the host nation spot to Inter Miami – and therefore Messi – without them having been crowned Major League Soccer champions. Comments by FIFA President Gianni Infantino, seemingly urging participating clubs to sign another modern great in Cristiano Ronaldo, further alerted the cynics. Miami also had the honour of hosting the tournament's opening match at their Hard Rock Stadium. During an on-pitch address at an MLS game ahead of the tournament, Infantino gushed: “Miami loves football, the world loves football and the world loves Miami. So I have three things to tell you. “The first: many congratulations for winning the Supporters' Shield [the regular season league before the play-offs]. And on top, with the record of points in Major League Soccer. “Congratulations, you are the best team of the season in America. Second, based on this outstanding performance this year, you deserve to be, and you will be, for the FIFA Club World Cup 2025. “And third, as the host team of the FIFA Club World Cup 2025, you will have the honour of opening the tournament by hosting the opening game here in Miami at the Hard Rock Stadium in front of 65,000 people and tens of millions at home.” That cut little ice with many MLS fans who believe Miami were favoured for having the world's best player and one of football's most famous faces as a co-owner in Beckham. One fan moaned: “The criteria was always the same. Whichever team had Lionel Messi was gonna qualify.” Another said: “Even if Miami had the worst season of their history, they would have still gotten the spot. The fact that there was no criteria to get the spot means that FIFA and the MLS intended to ask Miami to fill in the final spot, they just needed a good excuse.” In the end, Miami arguably justified their place in the tournament by advancing from their group with one win and two draws before being thumped by Paris Saint-Germain 4-0 in the round of 16. Miami fans can look forward to more Messi magic after the Argentina great signed a new long-term deal with the club. It means the eight-time Ballon d'Or winner will now be with the club when they move to their new Freedom Park home in 2026. Messi told his club's website: “It makes me really happy to stay here and to continue with this project that, besides being a dream, has become a beautiful reality — playing in this stadium, at Miami Freedom Park. Since I arrived in Miami, I've been very happy, so I'm truly glad to keep going here.” Join our new WhatsApp community and receive your daily dose of Mirror Football content. We also treat our community members to special offers, promotions, and adverts from us and our partners. If you don't like our community, you can check out any time you like. If you're curious, you can read our Privacy Notice. Fanatics has slashed up to 60% off football kits and merch. Until Sunday, fans can find discounts on products from Premier League clubs including Man United, Man City, Liverpool, Everton, Arsenal, Spurs and more. Cristiano Ronaldo reveals the 'most important tool' behind his longevity as Portuguese superstar admits suprisingly late bedtime
Source: Goal.com    Published: 2025-10-25 11:47:40

Cristiano Ronaldo has revealed what he thinks is the "most important tool" behind his longevity after plying his trade across Europe and now in Saudi Arabia. The Portuguese icon is showing no signs of slowing down, even at 40, as he continues to chase down records with Al-Nassr and on the international stage. He has set himself the mind-boggling target of reaching 1,000 career goals before hanging up his boots, and he is just 51 short of reaching that total.
WORLD NATIONAL BUSINESS CRYPTOCURRENCY SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY HEALTH SOCCER TENNIS FORMULA_1 ENTERTAINMENT OTHER


Goalkeeper Great Alyssa Naeher on Connecticut Homecoming: ‘It's Special'
Source: US Soccer    Published: 2025-10-25 11:17:45

Get unrivaled matchday access Two-time Women's World Cup champion. Olympic gold medalist. Third-place all-time in goalkeeper caps, wins, and shutouts in USWNT history. The 2024 U.S. Soccer Player of the Year. The first goalkeeper in USWNT history to make three or more saves in a penalty kick shootout. Oh, she did it twice. And, as of August, recipient of the NWSL Goal of the Week. To compile the accomplished resume owned by Alyssa Naeher requires relentless training, adroit hands and a work-oriented mindset. It also takes, according to Naeher, a village. “That's the fun part of sports in general is the relationships and the connections that you make,” Naeher said. “None of us can do this on our own, so it's the village that you have. It's the people that you have in your corner.” A village will accompany Naeher for the pre-match celebration to honor her international career at the upcoming U.S. Women's National Team match on Sunday, Oct. 26 in East Hartford, Connecticut. To commemorate Naeher and her storied career with the USWNT, the first 2,000 fans through the gate at Pratt & Whitney Stadium at Rentschler Field will receive a limited-edition collectible bobblehead. Naeher, a Connecticut native, closed the chapter on international soccer on Dec. 3, 2024, approximately 10 years from her senior team debut. Though the goalkeeper still plays professionally for the Chicago Stars FC in the NWSL, the 37-year-old feels content about her decision to stow away her international goalie gloves. “I was able to do everything that I had set out to do – and then some,” she said. “Honestly, it far exceeded my expectations, what I've been fortunate enough to be a part of. It just felt like the right time.” A return to her home state to celebrate her decorated career with the U.S. Women's National Team will be a special moment. Connecticut is where Naeher first learned to play soccer and where she spent the formative years of childhood, middle school and high school. At the club level, she played at Yankee United (U-12 through U-15) and then South Central (for U-16 to U-19). In high school, she was a three-time All-State selection at Christian Heritage School. Those who will attend her pre-match celebration include her devoted family. Her parents, John and Donna, still reside in Connecticut as do many of her early influences from her youth soccer era. She credits her sisters, twin Amanda and younger sister Abby, with wrangling together some former club teammates excited to show up and support. “'It's a small state, but we're a proud state,” Naeher said. “I'm looking forward to being able to go back… It's been fun to see people coming out and supporting. I realize that they've kept up with my career the whole time, tracking along and sharing it with their kids and their families.” When asked about growing up in Connecticut, Naeher spoke fondly and with gratitude, saying she never had one bad experience. On the latest episode of the U.S. Soccer Podcast, Naeher dives into more of her upbringing as a coach's kid and shares memories with longtime friend and teammate Meghan Klingenberg. Part two of their conversation drops Wednesday, Oct. 29. One person who played a significant role in Naeher's career was the goalkeeper coach she met when she was 14 years old, Paul DelloStritto. Naeher describes him as a “big brother” who is essentially part of the family. He was one of the first people to see her talent from a young age and always encouraged Naeher, known for her self-contained confidence and serious work ethic, to also have fun on the pitch. “He always taught me goalkeepers stick together,” she said. “No matter what happens in the game, no matter what scores are like, the first person you need to find after [the game] and go shake hands with is the other goalkeeper. That always stuck out with me. That competitiveness, but also the camaraderie of the position and the respect that you have towards your opponents.” In a state home to the UConn Huskies, which boasts 18 national championships combined in men's and women's college basketball, basketball played a part in Naeher's life growing up. She played basketball all the way to her senior year of high school. She credited a lot of her success to being a multi-sport athlete, saying that it helped her stay well-rounded. She realized that soccer would potentially provide a better avenue for her future, and she ended up playing soccer collegiately at Penn State where she was a two-time First-Team All-American. Even though she left to play college soccer a couple states away, it was during those years when she created one of her most beloved Connecticut memories. During an away trip to play against UConn, she brought her Penn State teammates to her Connecticut home. Her parents invited everyone over, and Naeher remembers the joy she felt seeing her two worlds merge for one night, evidenced by watching her grandmother sit in a rocking chair by the fire and talk to her coach for hours. “That memory certainly comes to mind of just where soccer had taken me,” Naeher said. “It sums up what sports can do. It mixes and blends so many different worlds and people that you would never really get to know or interact with other than this one thing that bonds you.” On Sunday, Naeher will have another chance to merge her differing worlds together – and as someone as accomplished as she is, it will be more than just introducing her hometown to her college teammates. It will encompass an entire career's worth of supporters – her family, friends, U.S. teammates, current Chicago teammates, youth coaches, youth teammates and all the fans who rooted for her along the way. In essence, the entire Alyssa Naeher village. “To be able to share that moment with them and put a ribbon on such a fun part of my life is something that I'm very grateful to get to be able to do,” she said.
WORLD NATIONAL BUSINESS CRYPTOCURRENCY SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY HEALTH SOCCER TENNIS FORMULA_1 ENTERTAINMENT OTHER


Morocco U17 Women Qualify for World Cup Knockout Stage for the First Time
Source: Morocco World News    Published: 2025-10-25 10:04:22

Home > News > Morocco U17 Women Qualify for World Cup Knockout Stage for the First Time Morocco U17 W team made history as they won 3-1 against Costa Rica and progressed to the knockout stage of the FIFA U17 Women's World Cup. (Credits: panafricafootball.com) Morocco's U17 women's team made history on Friday as they won 3-1 against Costa Rica and progressed to the knockout stage of the FIFA U17 Women's World Cup for the first time. The team finished a respectable third in Group A with 3 points, ahead of Costa Rica. Maysa Baha truly led from the front with 2 goals in the 4th and 39th minutes and Morocco's third came from a bit of a surprise with a 77th-minute own goal from the Costa Rican side. Morocco's midfield and defense had a good day out as they worked together to create the openings for the team to score. Pressing high up the pitch put pressure on Costa Rica, and when the ball did get into the final third, Morocco's composure paid off in a big way, with the team ending up with a lead that couldn't be clawed back even after Costa Rica scored in the 95th minute. The 2025 FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup in Morocco features 24 teams spread across 6 groups, with the top two teams from each group qualifying directly. Plus, the 4 best third-placed sides qualify for the knockout stages. With 4 goals scored and 7 conceded, Morocco outscored Ecuador and the Netherlands in the process, earning them their ticket to the Round of 16 The tournament marks a milestone for Morocco who are this year hosting their first-ever FIFA tournament and also the first time that their U17 women's side has ever made it past the group stages of a World Cup. Making it to the knockout stage brings huge kudos to Morocco's women's football development program. Qualifying for the U-17 World Cup for the first time in 2022, and now reaching the Round of 16 as hosts in 2025, shows just how far the country has come in a short time. Now it's on to the next stage. Morocco will need to wait and see who their opponents are going to be, with the outcome very much still to be decided. Your email address will not be published. Required fields are marked * Comment * Name * Email * Website Save my name, email, and website in this browser for the next time I comment. Real Madrid stars 'fed up' with Lamine Yamal after Barcelona wonderkid stoked flames of El Clasico
Source: Goal.com    Published: 2025-10-25 09:00:28

The Real Madrid dressing has responded angrily to Lamine Yamal's comments about the club as tensions ahead of El Clasico reach boiling point. Los Blancos are supposedly frustrated with Yamal, whose off the pitch antics are beginning to get under the skin of the players in the Spanish capital. Ahead of Sunday's game, Yamal has added fuel to the fire.
